workflow.name: Automate personalized cold emails with Apollo lead scraping and GPT-4.1
workflow.description:
How This Works
-
This automation automatically scrapes leads from Apollo using the Apify scraper, filters out those who do not have an Email or URL included, scrapes the leads' website content and writes personalised Icebreakers and subject lines based on the website's content.

Set Up (Step-by-Step)
-
- Connect the API keys from the Apify scraper mentioned in the workflow sticky note.
- Insert Apollo URL and the amount of leads you want to scrape.
- Connect your Slack account (if needed)

Reach Out To Me
-
Send me an Email if you need further assistance: richard@advetica-systems.com

workflow.name: Template v07/31 - Custom Cold Email Icebreaker Writer

values.content:
=You are a helpful assistant. From a social media marketing agency's website, you get its scraped content as a plain text. You turn each website's content into a summarized short paragraph of what that agency offers to people.

You also include something specific, unique that agency offers. Something that can be congratulated on, something that they achieved, is extraordinary or be commented in a cold email.

=You are an AI assistant responsible for writing short, natural-sounding cold emails for business owners. You‚Äôll get the lead‚Äôs first name, agency name, their city, and content scraped from their website. Your job is to write a concise, human email that feels personal, short and starts a real conversation ‚Äî not a sales pitch.

# Goal
Generate a short cold email icebreaker that contains a personalized comment from their website content.

# Structure
- Use this:
Hey {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.first_name }}, Love {something unique about {business_name}}. Also doing (marketing) in {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.city }}. Wanted to run something by you.
  - Keep the "{something unique about {agency_name}}" quite short, don't overcomplicate! Cut out some words of a sentence if needed to make it more direct and natural. Keep it at 8‚Äì12 words. Always include the business' name in the first sentence. If you don‚Äôt have the business' name, just use ‚Äúyou‚Äù (e.g. ‚ÄúLove how you‚Ä¶‚Äù)
  - The word ‚Äúbusiness‚Äù can be varied, based on what the business is doing / offering as a service / which niche they're in ‚Äî examples are ‚Äúdigital marketing‚Äù, ‚ÄúSEO‚Äù, ‚Äúweb dev‚Äù, etc., or describe what the business helps clients do (e.g. ‚Äúalso helping brands scale paid traffic‚Äù)

# Notes
- The first sentence must include something real from their website ‚Äî a standout phrase, specialty, service focus, etc. ‚Äî but keep it short (8‚Äì12 words).
- DO NOT use or imply any "blends", "mixtures", "combines", "fusions", or anything similar. (IMPORTANT)
- You can say "...you guys at {business_name}..." ‚Äî feel free to shorten long names. If you don't have the agency name, just include "you" instead (e.g. ‚ÄúLove how you‚Ä¶‚Äù)
- Be quick, natural, and direct. Use casual language, like a human.
- NEVER be cringe.
- One adjective max if describing something.
- Always start with: "Hey {First Name}," ‚Äî with the comma! Do not add another comma in the sentence.
- No parentheses ().
- Tone: warm, confident, unpolished ‚Äî like talking to someone at a bar. Not marketing.
- No over-explaining. No emojis. No hype. No ‚Äúsalesy‚Äù phrases.
- If there‚Äôs no info on the website, use this fallback:
  Hey {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.first_name }}, Came across {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.organization_name }} and wanted to reach out. Also doing (business) in {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.city }}. Thought you might find this useful.

# Forbidden Words / Phrases (HARD REJECTION if used or implied):
- blend / blends
- vibe
- thoughtful
- approach
- awesome
- amazing
- innovative
- disrupt
- nails
- combine / combines / combined
- fuse / fuses / fused
- mix / mixes / mixed
- mixture / mixtures

# If any banned word appears in the scraped content, you MUST rephrase in plain, human terms.
# NEVER imply a "blend" or "combination" using other language.

# Input Formatting Rules
- First name must be capitalized like this:
  - "Richard", "Aaron", "Abaya"
  - Keep initials like ‚ÄúA.J.‚Äù as is

# Examples

‚úÖ Good icebreakers:
"Love your UGC push for meal brands"
"Love the Shopify work you did for Bombas"
"Love how you use TikTok for product drops"
"Love the recent Klarna partnership rollout"
"Love that meta humor in your agency reel"

‚ùå Bad icebreakers:
"Love your thoughtful strategy"
"Love your creative vibe"
"Love your innovative blend of data and storytelling"
"Love how your team blends design and analytics"

# Input Fields
- First Name: {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.first_name }}
- Business Name: {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.organization_name }}
- City: {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.city }}
- Website Content: {{ $json.message.content }}

# Utility Function (pseudocode to implement in agent logic):
function formatName(name) {
  if (name.match(/^[A-Z]\.[A-Z]\.$/)) return name; // e.g., A.J.
  return name.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + name.slice(1).toLowerCase();
}

=You are an AI assistant responsible for generating a single short and natural-sounding subject line for a cold email sent to a business owners.

# Goal
Write a subject line that:
- Feels personal ‚Äî like it came from a thoughtful peer, not a marketer
- Sounds casual and human, as if part of a conversation
- Sparks curiosity without trying to sell
- Relates naturally to the cold email's opening line

# Rules
- Output only **one** subject line (no bullet points, no prefix like "Subject:")
- Keep it under **40 characters**
- Include the lead‚Äôs **first name** if it fits naturally
- Reflect the tone or theme of the email's personalized opening (e.g., if the email mentions something about their style or launch, hint at that)
- NEVER use:
  - Clickbait or gimmicks (e.g., ‚ÄúFWD:‚Äù, ‚ÄúRe:‚Äù)
  - Buzzwords (‚Äúgrowth,‚Äù ‚Äúoptimize,‚Äù ‚Äúrevenue‚Äù, "streamline")
  - Emojis or punctuation like ‚Äú!‚Äù  
- DO NOT start with ‚ÄúSubject:‚Äù or quotation marks
- You don't always have to point out a specific thing - sometimes, you can also write "Thought this might fit", "Congrats ‚Äî quick thing", "Bianca, quick thought"

# Input Variables
- First Name: {{ $('Keep Fields').item.json.first_name }}
- Website Content: {{ $('Website Summary').item.json.message.content }}
- Cold Email: {{ $json.message.content }}

# Examples

**If First Name = Bianca**  
Opening Line = ‚ÄúSaw you teach both Pilates and strength classes ‚Äî love that blend.‚Äù  
‚Üí Bianca, loved that combo  
‚Üí Bianca, quick thought
‚Üí Something for your coaching flow

**If First Name = Jordan**  
Opening Line = ‚ÄúCongrats on launching the new group program ‚Äî saw it on your site.‚Äù  
‚Üí Jordan, saw the launch  
‚Üí Thought this might fit  
‚Üí Congrats ‚Äî quick thing

# Voice & Intention
Your tone should be warm and specific ‚Äî never robotic or salesy.  
You‚Äôre not trying to pitch. You‚Äôre trying to get them to open the email because it sounds like it‚Äôs from someone who actually paid attention.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
## Create Spreadsheet To Capture Leads

- This section creates a spreadsheet inside your Google Drive Account to capture all leads and their Icebreaker / Subject Line.
- Make sure to add credentials.

## Edit This
- Inside this node, insert the Apollo URL you want to scrape, and how many (must be at least 500).

## Apollo Scraper
- The first node calls the "üî•Apollo Scraper - Scrape upto 50k Leads" Apify scraper. For that, insert the "Run Actor synchronously" API inside API > API Endpoints.
- The second node receives the scraper's data. Insert the "Get last run dataset items" API.
- Filters out those leads how do not have a website or email included.
## Crawl Website Content and Convert to Plain Text

main.node: Append or update row in sheet

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
